messages:
You are an expert legal adviser on EU regulations, particularly Solvency II.
In case of formula's output in latex format with $, $$ dollar signs.
If none of the sources provided the answer, just say you don't know.

## Question
        

 Wat is de maximale impact van een herverzekeringscontract op de hoogte van de premievolumemaat in het premierisico? 


        
## Context
        

 
### source 1 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER V*

* Header 3: Section 10

* Header 5: Article 208
:

 extract:

 2. Where insurance or reinsurance undertakings transfer underwriting risks using finite reinsurance, as defined in
Article 210(3) of Directive 2009/138/EC, that meet the requirements set out in Articles 209, 211 and 213 of this
Regulation, these contracts shall be recognised in the scenario based calculations set out in Title I, Chapter V, Sections 2,
3 and 4 of this Regulation only to the extent underwriting risk is transferred to the counterparty of the contract.
Notwithstanding the previous sentence, finite reinsurance, or similar arrangements, where the lack of effective risk
transfer is comparable to that of finite reinsurance, shall not be taken into account for the purposes of determining the
volume measures for premium and reserve risk in accordance with in Articles 116 and 147 of this Regulation, or for
the purposes of calculating undertaking-specific parameters in accordance with Section 13 of this Chapter. 



### source 2 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER V*

* Header 3: Section 4

* Header 5: Article 147
:

 extract:

 (a) premiums in relation to non-insurance events or settled insurance claims that are not accounted for in the cashflows referred to in Article 41(3);


(b) premiums for reinsurance contracts that do not comply with Articles 209, 210, 211 and 213.

6. For all segments set out in Annex XIV, the volume measure for reserve risk of a particular segment shall be equal
to the best estimate for the provision for claims outstanding for the segment, after deduction of the amounts recoverable
from reinsurance contracts and special purpose vehicles, provided that the reinsurance contracts or special purpose
vehicles comply with Articles 209, 210, 211 and 213. The volume measure shall not be a negative amount.


7. For all segments set out in Annex XIV, the default factor for geographical diversification shall be either equal to 1
or calculated in accordance with Annex III.

 * Title: Directive 2009/138/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 November 2009 on the taking-up and pursuit of the business of Insurance and Reinsurance (Solvency II)
* Header 1: TITLE V

* Header 5: Article 17b
:

 extract:

 (b) the second result:


for policies on which the capital at risk is not a negative
figure, a 0,3 % fraction of such capital underwritten by
the institution shall be multiplied by the ratio, which
shall not be less than 50 %, for the previous financial
year, of the total capital at risk retained as the institu­
tion’s liability after reinsurance cessions and retroces­
sions to the total capital at risk gross of reinsurance.


For temporary assurances on death of a maximum term
of three years, that fraction shall be 0,1 %. For such
assurance of a term of more than three years but not
more than five years, that fraction shall be 0,15 %. 



### source 4 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER V*

* Header 3: Section 2

* Header 5: Article 116
:

 extract:

 **Volume measure for non-life premium and reserve risk**


1. The volume measure for non-life premium and reserve risk shall be equal to the sum of the volume measures for
premium and reserve risk of the segments set out in Annex II.


2. For all segments set out in Annex II, the volume measure of a particular segment _s_ shall be equal to the following:

$$
V_s = (V_{{(\text{{prem}},s)}} + V_{{(\text{{res}},s)}}) \cdot (0,75 + 0,25 \cdot \text{{DIV}}_s)
$$

where:
(a)(a) _V_ _(prem,s)_ denotes the volume measure for premium risk of segment _s_ ;


(b) _V_ _(res,s)_ denotes the volume measure for reserve risk of segment _s_ ;


(c) _DIV_ _s_ denotes the factor for geographical diversification of segment _s_ .


3. For all segments set out in Annex II, the volume measure for premium risk of a particular segment _s_ shall be equal
to the following:

$$
V_{{(\text{{prem}},s)}} = \max[P_s; P_{{(\text{{last}},s)}}] + \text{{FP}}_{{(\text{{existing}},s)}} + \text{{FP}}_{{(\text{{future}},s)}}
$$

where:
(a)(a) _P_ _s_ denotes an estimate of the premiums to be earned by the insurance or reinsurance undertaking in the segment s
during the following 12 months; 



### source 5 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER V*

* Header 3: Section 2

* Header 5: Article 117
:

 extract:

 (d) _V_ _(res,s)_ denotes the volume measure for reserve risk of segment _s_ referred to in Article 116.


3. For all segments set out in Annex II, the standard deviation for non-life premium risk of a particular segment shall
be equal to the product of the standard deviation for non-life gross premium risk of the segment set out in Annex II and
the adjustment factor for non-proportional reinsurance. For segments 1, 4 and 5 set out in Annex II the adjustment
factor for non-proportional reinsurance shall be equal to 80 %. For all other segments set out in Annex the adjustment
factor for non-proportional reinsurance shall be equal to 100 %. 


 


        
## Answer
        

 When answering reference ONLY if applicable source with (Source <insert number>). Answer based on the mentioned sources in the Context answer the Question.

Op basis van de verstrekte bronnen is de maximale impact van een herverzekeringscontract als volgt:

Een herverzekeringscontract kan de relevante maatstaf voor het risico met maximaal 50% verlagen. De verhouding tussen het totale voor risico van de instelling blijvende kapitaal na herverzekering en het totale voor risico van de instelling zijnde kapitaal vóór herverzekering mag niet lager zijn dan 50% (Source 3).

### Toelichting

*   **Artikel 17b van Richtlijn 2009/138/EG** stelt dat voor de berekening een breukdeel van het door de instelling onderschreven kapitaal wordt vermenigvuldigd met een ratio. Deze ratio, die het effect van herverzekering weergeeft, mag niet lager zijn dan 50% (Source 3).

*   Voor specifieke segmenten van niet-levensverzekeringen (segmenten 1, 4 en 5 in Bijlage II) is er een aanpassingsfactor voor niet-proportionele herverzekering van 80%. Deze factor is echter van toepassing op de *standaarddeviatie* voor het premierisico, niet direct op de premievolumemaat zelf (Source 5).

*   Het is belangrijk op te merken dat "finite reinsurance" (beperkte risico-overdracht) niet in aanmerking wordt genomen voor de bepaling van de volumematen voor premie- en reserverisico (Source 1).

## Question
        

 Het antwoord lijkt vooral gericht op levensverzekeringen. Gelden deze regels ook voor schadeverzekeraars? 


        
## Context
        

 
### source 1 

 metadata:
 * Title: Directive 2009/138/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 November 2009 on the taking-up and pursuit of the business of Insurance and Reinsurance (Solvency II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER V*

* Header 5: Article 74
:

 extract:

 The minimum financial obligations referred to in the first sub­
paragraph, in respect of the life insurance activity and the nonlife insurance activity, shall not be borne by the other activity.


4. As long as the minimum financial obligations referred to in
paragraph 3 are fulfilled and provided the supervisory authority
is informed, the undertaking may use to cover the Solvency Capi­
tal Requirement referred to in Article 100, the explicit eligible
own-fund items which are still available for one or the other
activity.

11.72.2009 EN



Official Journ al of the E uropean Un ion L 335/45



5. The supervisory authorities shall analyse the results in both
life and non-life insurance activities so as to ensure that the
requirements of paragraphs 1 to 4 are fulfilled. 



### source 2 

 metadata:
 * Title: Directive 2009/138/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 November 2009 on the taking-up and pursuit of the business of Insurance and Reinsurance (Solvency II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER I*

* Header 3: Section 1

* Header 5: Article 2
:

 extract:

 **Scope**


1. This Directive shall apply to direct life and non-life insur­
ance undertakings which are established in the territory of a Mem­
ber State or which wish to become established there.


It shall also apply to reinsurance undertakings which conduct
only reinsurance activities and which are established in the terri­
tory of a Member State or which wish to become established there
with the exception of Title IV.

### source 5 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER VII*

* Header 5: Article 252
:

 extract:

 6. The notional Solvency Capital Requirement for non-life insurance or reinsurance activity shall be equal to the
following:

$$
\text{{NSCR}}_{{\text{{nl}}}} = \frac{{\text{{NMCR}}_{{(\text{{linear,nl}})}}}}{{\text{{NMCR}}_{{(\text{{linear,nl}})}} + \text{{NMCR}}_{{(\text{{linear,l}})}}}} \cdot \text{{SCR}}
$$

where:
(a)(a) _SCR_ denotes the Solvency Capital Requirement calculated in accordance with Title I, Chapter VI, Section 4,
Subsection 2 of Directive 2009/138/EC or with Title I, Chapter VI, Section 4, Subsection 3 of Directive/EC, which shall for the purposes of this Article exclude any capital add-on imposed in accordance with
Article 37 of that Directive;


(b) _NMCR_ _(linear,nl)_ denotes the notional linear non-life Minimum Capital Requirement for non-life insurance or reinsurance
activity;


(c) _NMCR_ _(linear,l)_ denotes the notional linear Minimum Capital Requirement for life insurance or reinsurance activity.


7. The notional life Minimum Capital Requirement shall be equal to the following:

$$
\text{{NMCR}}_{{\text{{l}}}} = \max(\text{{NMCR}}_{{(\text{{combined,l}})}}; \text{{AMCR}}_{{\text{{l}}}})
$$

where:
(a)(a) _NMCR_ _(combined,l)_ denotes the notional combined life Minimum Capital Requirement; 


 


        
## Answer
        

 When answering reference ONLY if applicable source with (Source <insert number>). Answer based on the mentioned sources in the Context answer the Question.

Ja, de Solvency II-regelgeving is van toepassing op zowel levens- als schadeverzekeraars.

Op basis van de verstrekte bronnen kan het volgende worden geconcludeerd:

1.  **Toepassingsgebied**: De Solvency II-richtlijn (2009/138/EG) is expliciet van toepassing op zowel directe levens- als schadeverzekeringsondernemingen (Source 2).
2.  **Specifieke bepalingen**: De richtlijn bevat hoofdstukken met bepalingen die specifiek zijn voor schadeverzekeringen ("Provisions specific to non-life insurance") en bepalingen die specifiek zijn voor levensverzekeringen ("Provisions specific to life insurance") (Source 3, Source 4).
3.  **Gescheiden behandeling**: De regelgeving vereist een gescheiden analyse en behandeling van de activiteiten en financiële verplichtingen van de levens- en schadeverzekeringsactiviteiten binnen één onderneming (Source 1, Source 5).

Hoewel de overkoepelende principes voor beide gelden, kunnen de specifieke berekeningsmethoden en parameters, zoals de impact van herverzekering op de kapitaalvereisten, verschillen tussen de levens- en schadeverzekeringsmodules. De in het vorige antwoord genoemde regel van 50% was gebaseerd op een artikel dat specifiek verwijst naar "capital at risk", een term die doorgaans in de context van levensverzekeringen wordt gebruikt. Voor schadeverzekeraars gelden andere specifieke berekeningen voor het premierisico, zoals beschreven in de Gedelegeerde Verordening (EU) 2015/35.

## Question
        

 Kun je de specifieke berekeningen voor het premierisico voor schadeverzekeraars waar je naar verwijst noemen? 


        
## Context
        

 
### source 1 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER V*

* Header 3: Section 2

* Header 5: Article 116
:

 extract:

 4. For all segments set out in Annex II, insurance and reinsurance undertakings may, as an alternative to the
calculation set out in paragraph 3 of this Article, choose to calculate the volume measure for premium risk of a
particular segment _s_ in accordance with the following formula:


_V_ ð _prem,s_ Þ ¼ _P_ _s_ þ _FP_ ð _existing,s_ Þ þ _FP_ ð _future,s_ Þ


provided that the all of following conditions are met:


(a) the administrative, management or supervisory body of the insurance or reinsurance undertaking has decided that
its earned premiums in the segment _s_ during the following 12 months will not exceed _P_ _s_ ;


(b) the insurance or reinsurance undertaking has established effective control mechanisms to ensure that the limits on
earned premiums referred to in point (a) will be met;


(c) the insurance or reinsurance undertaking has informed its supervisory authority about the decision referred to in
point (a) and the reasons for it. 



### source 2 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II):

 extract:

 (45) In relation to premium risk, the calculation of the capital requirement for non-life and health premium and
reserve risk should be based on the larger of the past and the expected future earned premiums to take account
of the uncertainty around the future earned premiums. However, where an insurance or reinsurance undertaking
can reliably ensure that the future earned premiums will not exceed the expected premiums, the calculation
should be based on the expected earned premiums only.


(46) In order to reflect the average characteristics of life insurance obligations, the modelling of mass lapse risk in the
Solvency Capital Requirement standard formula should be based on the assumption that the risk relating to the
options that a ceding insurance or reinsurance undertaking of a reinsurance contract may exercise is not material
for the accepting insurance or reinsurance undertaking. 



### source 3

* Header 1: _ANNEX XVII_
:

 extract:

 (d) ‘financial year’ means, with respect to a payment for an insurance or reinsurance claim, the year in which
this payment took place.


(2) For the purpose of this annex, ‘segment _s_ ’ denotes the segment for which the undertaking-specific parameter is
determined, being one of the segments set out in Annex II or one of the segments set out in Annex XIV.


B. **Premium risk method**


**Input data and method-specific data requirements**


(1) The data for estimating the undertaking-specific standard deviation of segment _s_ shall consist of the following:


(a) the payments made and the best estimates of the provision for claims outstanding in segment _s_ after the first
development year of the accident year of those claims (aggregated losses);


(b) the premiums earned in segment _s_ ;


Those aggregated losses and earned premiums shall be available separately for each accident year of the
insurance and reinsurance claims in segment _s_ .

Official Journ al of the E uropean Un ion L 335/53



(b) the risk of loss, or of adverse change in the value of insur­

## Answer
        

 When answering reference ONLY if applicable source with (Source <insert number>). Answer based on the mentioned sources in the Context answer the Question.

Zeker, op basis van de verstrekte documenten zijn dit de specifieke berekeningen en methoden voor het premierisico voor schadeverzekeraars:

### Berekening van de Volumemaat voor Premierisico

De Gedelegeerde Verordening (EU) 2015/35 beschrijft de berekening van de volumemaat voor het premierisico. De standaardberekening is gebaseerd op het grootste van de verdiende premies uit het verleden en de verwachte toekomstige verdiende premies (Source 2).

Er is ook een alternatieve berekeningsmethode beschikbaar onder strikte voorwaarden. Een verzekeraar kan ervoor kiezen om de volumemaat voor premierisico voor een specifiek segment *s* als volgt te berekenen:

$$
V_{{(\text{{prem}},s)}} = P_s + \text{{FP}}_{{(\text{{existing}},s)}} + \text{{FP}}_{{(\text{{future}},s)}}
$$

Deze alternatieve methode mag alleen worden gebruikt als aan de volgende voorwaarden is voldaan:
a) Het bestuursorgaan van de verzekeraar heeft besloten dat de verdiende premies in het segment gedurende de komende 12 maanden niet hoger zullen zijn dan *Ps*.
b) De verzekeraar heeft effectieve controlemechanismen ingesteld om te garanderen dat deze premielimieten worden nageleefd.
c) De verzekeraar heeft de toezichthoudende autoriteit geïnformeerd over dit besluit en de redenen daarvoor (Source 1).

### Inputdata en de invloed van Herverzekering

Voor de berekening van de ondernemingsspecifieke standaardafwijking van het premierisico (de "Premium risk method") zijn de volgende inputgegevens vereist:
*   **Geaggregeerde schades**: De betalingen en de beste schatting van de voorziening voor nog af te wikkelen schades.
*   **Verdiende premies**: De premies verdiend in het betreffende segment (Source 3).

Herverzekering heeft een directe impact op deze inputdata:
*   De **geaggregeerde schades** worden gecorrigeerd voor de bedragen die verhaalbaar zijn uit hoofde van herverzekeringscontracten.
*   De **verdiende premies** worden gecorrigeerd voor de herverzekeringspremies die betaald worden (Source 4).

Deze berekeningen maken deel uit van de "niet-levensverzekeringstechnische risicomodule", die het risico van verlies of een ongunstige wijziging in de waarde van verzekeringsverplichtingen weerspiegelt als gevolg van schommelingen in de timing, frequentie en omvang van verzekerde voorvallen (Source 5).
